rules.title: Game Rules
rules.subtitle: Discover all the rules and become a master of UNIT. Click on a card to learn more.

general.title: General Rules
general.description: The basics of the game and fundamental principles
rules: The game is played with a standard 52-card deck plus 2 jokers
The goal is to create columns of cards following specific rules
Special cards have unique powers that can change the course of the game
strategies: Always keep a special card in reserve
Observe your opponents' game
Plan your actions several moves ahead

faq.question: How many cards can you have in hand?
faq.answer: Each player can have up to 5 cards in hand.

faq.question: Can you play multiple cards per turn?
faq.answer: No, only one card can be played per turn.

king.title: The King
king.description: Control the board with the King
rules: The King can be placed on any card
It allows you to take control of an entire column
Once placed, the King can only be moved by another King
strategies: Use the King to capture strategic columns
Keep a King in reserve to counter your opponent's
Combine the King with other special cards for powerful combos

faq.question: Can a King be moved?
faq.answer: Yes, but only by another King.

faq.question: Can you have multiple Kings in the same column?
faq.answer: No, only one King can control a column at a time.

queen.title: The Queen
queen.description: Use the power of the Queen
rules: The Queen can move freely on the board
She can take any card except a King
The Queen can protect adjacent cards
strategies: Use the Queen to protect your important cards
Create synergies with other special cards
Place the Queen strategically to block opponent moves

faq.question: Can the Queen take a King?
faq.answer: No, the King is the only card that the Queen cannot take.

jack.title: The Jack
jack.description: Master the movements of the Jack
rules: The Jack allows you to move a card to another column
It can be used to reorganize the playing field
Cannot move Kings
strategies: Use the Jack to disrupt opponent strategies
Move key cards to create opportunities
Save your important cards from dangerous situations

faq.question: Can the Jack move multiple cards at once?
faq.answer: No, the Jack can only move one card at a time.

joker.title: The Joker
joker.description: Discover the special powers of the Joker
rules: The Joker can copy the power of any card
It can be played at any time
Only one Joker can be active at a time
strategies: Save the Joker for critical situations
Adapt your strategy based on available powers
Use the Joker to surprise your opponents

faq.question: Can the Joker copy a King?
faq.answer: Yes, the Joker can copy any card, including the King.

lucky7.title: Lucky 7
rules: The 7 allows you to draw an additional card
If you draw another 7, you can draw again
Maximum of three cards can be drawn per turn
strategies: Use the 7 when you need specific cards
Combine with other cards for powerful combos
Keep a 7 in reserve for critical moments

faq.question: Can you play the drawn cards immediately?
faq.answer: No, drawn cards can only be played on the next turn.

units.title: The Units
units.description: Learn to use the basic cards
rules: Units are cards from 2 to 10
They can be placed in any column
Units follow specific placement rules
strategies: Create combinations with special cards
Use units to prepare for bigger moves
Don't underestimate the power of small units

faq.question: How do you place units?
faq.answer: Units must be placed according to their value and color.
